what_to_do.task: Configure Leave Encashment Policy and Calculation
steps: Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Leave encashment policy or End of Service eligibility section.
Access Payroll Settings and select the Payroll tab.
Click 'Add New' to create a new leave encashment policy or configure existing settings.
Set policy details including policy name, description, and applicable leave types.
Select salary components for leave encashment calculation (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances).
Choose the calculation method: calendar days, working days, or custom days based on Time Off policy.
Define eligibility criteria such as minimum accrued leave days, minimum job tenure, and probation period restrictions.
Select eligible employees for the policy, either all employees or a custom selection.
Review and save the leave encashment policy configuration.
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Leave encashment policies are configured correctly with appropriate salary components, calculation methods, eligibility criteria, and employee assignments, enabling accurate leave encashment processing.

what_to_do.task: Set up Leave Encashment Employee Ticket
steps: Enable the Leave Encashment ticket type.
Configure admin roles allowed to manage leave encashment tickets.
Select employees who can request leave encashment tickets, choosing between all employees or a custom selection.
Review and save the ticket type configuration.
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Leave Encashment ticket type is enabled and configured with appropriate admin roles and employee eligibility, facilitating leave encashment requests via tickets.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Custom role configuration complexity for leave encashment approvals
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No intuitive UI for mapping custom roles to leave encashment policies; custom roles do not automatically appear in approval workflows without backend admin intervention.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual backend configuration is required to map custom roles to policies to enable visibility in approval flows.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Leave Encashment ticket visibility cannot be restricted by employee selection
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system cannot filter Leave Encashment tickets based on specific employee assignments in payroll policies, defaulting to all employees view.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: No workaround available; selective ticket visibility is not supported.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Unclear handling of overused leave days in end of service leave encashment
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No explicit system behavior or documentation on how overused leave days are deducted in MOHRE-specific leave encashment calculations.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual verification and adjustment may be required to comply with MOHRE regulations.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Inaccurate prorated leave encashment calculations for partial year exits
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: System lacks precise day-level prorated leave calculation for employees leaving mid-month or partial year.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual calculation and adjustment needed for accurate leave encashment in such cases.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: User interface does not clearly confirm leave encashment configuration changes
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No immediate or clear indication that leave encashment settings have been successfully saved, causing user uncertainty.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users should verify changes by revisiting configuration screens or checking payroll results.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Incomplete Leave Encashment Policy setup workflow
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Frontend implementation of leave encashment policy setup is partial, missing final configuration steps.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users must complete available steps and await further platform updates for full workflow.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No backend endpoint for creating leave encashment requests
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Platform lacks API support for creating leave encashment requests programmatically.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Requests must be created manually through the UI; no automation possible.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No ability to delete leave encashment policies
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: System does not support deletion of leave encashment policies once created.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Policies must be disabled or replaced; deletion is not possible.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Lack of detailed employee eligibility view for leave encashment
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No dedicated admin interface to screen or filter employees eligible for leave encashment.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Admins must manually review employee records or reports to determine eligibility.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Leave encashment reporting is fragmented across multiple reports
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users must access separate reports to view leave encashment data, reducing efficiency.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manually consolidate data from multiple reports for comprehensive view.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No workflow for handling leave encashment transaction statuses
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: System lacks comprehensive status management for leave encashment submissions and rejections.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual tracking of transaction statuses is required outside the system.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No manual entry for approved leave encashment requests in payroll
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Payroll system does not support manual addition of approved leave encashment requests.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: All leave encashment must be processed through automated workflows.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No configurable leave encashment toggle in time off policy settings
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Time Off Managers cannot enable or disable leave encashment within leave policy configurations.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Leave encashment must be managed separately from time off policies.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No specific role policy for leave encashment administration
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Role-based access control lacks a dedicated leave encashment admin role for fine-grained permissions.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Use existing roles with broader permissions; no dedicated leave encashment admin role available.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Leave encashment ticket status filters are not fully configurable
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Status filters for leave encashment tickets in QA state cannot be customized to user needs.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users must work within existing filter constraints.
